text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section and I'm here to bring a little
sunshine into your winter I'm going to
show you how to make the most refreshing
the brightest the puckery of salad of
your entire season and that's a citrus
salad I mean it's really cold outside
you don't want to go out to get salad
greens and you remember that arugula
that you bought last week looking pretty
sad in your fridge but chances are
you've got that grapefruit you meant to
eat for breakfast maybe there's an
orange somewhere in the back of your
fridge you can turn these into an
amazing salad when most people think
about peeling an orange they think oh
I'm going to go like this I'm gonna dig
my hand in and I'm gonna rip off the
peel ruins your manicure takes a really
long time and also it's kind of messy
for a salad because you've got all that
white pith but there's a really easy
trick to getting the peel off and I'm
going to show you how to do it so the
trick to it is to cut off the top of the
orange and then cut off the bottom so it
stands up and then just slip your knife
underneath the pith and expose all that
gorgeous juicy fruit underneath as you
can see it you are losing a little bit
of the fruit but that's okay you really
want it to be clean because you don't
want to eat the pith the pith is bitter
it's nasty you want to get rid of it and
now there are two things you can do once
you've peeled your orange like this you
can either use something that the French
called soup Reming the orange which is
this you take your knife and you want to
go in between the membranes and you are
slipping these little orange segments
right out look how pretty that is just
snip them out but you probably don't
want to take the time to supreme in
Orange every time you want to have a
salad so this is what I like to do
you take your peeled fruit and you just
slice it up just slice it crosswise you
can do thin slices you can do thick
slices I like to do medium slices about
a quarter-inch but I think that gives a
nice texture in the mouth the great
thing about this is that you can make
the salad ahead it'll last for an hour
or two so if you want to cut up your
citrus fruit you know while your roast
is in the oven it'll still work the same

while you're going just take the tip of

just take your knife and run it around

nobody wants to eat that
the only thing it won't work with our

because these have really loose skins so
in the case of these it's easier to just

there's not a lot of pit that's clinging
because this the peel just slips right

just so they're not flopping all over my

now that you've caught up all your

people always ask how much citrus for a

if you're two people double it and
onward and onward one thing about

instead of doing it in a normal salad

you're not tossing and the reason for

they're just gonna disintegrate
I like the season it's really simply

so I just used olive oil and sea salt
really simple of course you've got to

that's really what you're looking for
for the simplest citrus salads I don't
